text:
Hey here. 

I believe I might missed this. Anyway, I have few colleagues that would like to use cms-react for our production system. May I know where can they enroll or ungated for this beta feature?
No enrollment or beta sign-up is needed to use cms -react

Can visit <https://github.HubSpot.com/cms-react/> & <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-react/tree/main/examples/hello-world>

For more info / to get started
set the channel description: JavaScript based rendered CMS assets. <https://youtu.be/chj-_yBN5_c>

purpose: Server-side CMS rendering powered by React: <https://github.HubSpot.com/cms-react/>
text: set the channel description: Server-side CMS rendering powered by React: <https://github.HubSpot.com/cms-react/>
Thanks guys. I will pass the info

Following up here - I wanted to get clear on what the issue is.

Is there a validation error that doesn't make sense? i.e. your defaults for the field repeater were correct, however you were getting an error?
However, to be able to see the *CRM Development* section in the HubSpot Menu you have to register for the CRM UI Extensions beta
I'm not sure if this has changed in the last weeks or not, but it would be good to show the CRM Development menu item for React Projects as well, not only for UI Extension projects.

Any reason why a GitHub commit would not trigger a new deployment in the project? Yesterday I noticed that the project is not updating and when I checked in HubSpot I saw that the latest deployment was a few days ago and I've made commits since then. If I unlink the project from Github and then re-link it triggers a deployment.

Hey <@U02CS2Q38QG> 2 ideas to  check:

1. We output any deploy errors in the logs from the activity stream page (<https://app.HubSpot.com/developer-projects/<portal_id>/project/<project_name>/activity>); that will show any specific reasons that the platform was unable to deploy
2. Make sure that auto-deploy is enabled from the settings page (<https://app.HubSpot.com/developer-projects/<portal_id>/project/<project_name>/settings>)

Thanks for helping, Roger! I checked the activity stream and there are no errors or any other info, there's just the latest deploy info without anything new. The auto-deploy is enabled.

Is there something specific to which the auto-deploy listens to? I'm thinking that maybe my folder setup isn't ideal and HubSpot might not get the correct path (although, it is working when first connecting the project to Github).
We can take a further look if you share the portal / project info
Sure, I'll send the info in PM
I am having the same issue
Deleting the cli from the dependecies and updating it to the latest 5.1.3 fixes it
awesome! TY!
has anyone tried using the HubL `menu` function to built out a react menu? I'm about to give it a shot but I'm about to run into some data type issues...wish me luck!
no issues at all, works exactly as expected

hey you are right.. my colleagues are getting error like
```[ERROR] The current target account 44769124 does not have access to HubSpot projects. To opt in to the CRM Development Beta and use projects, visit <https://app.HubSpot.com/l/whats-new/betas?productUpdateId=13860216>.```

and I also have tried the suggestion in <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/crm-development-tools-overview#get-started|here> but no luck :disappointed:
Has there been a solve yet for `hs secrets` not working in the CLI?
